page.title: 11VEHICLES ON ST.MARTINS
page.content: There is only one main road on St.Martins,it runs from the quay through the three hamlets down to a beach at the western end of the island.The road was built with cement by the island men,it was started in the 1960's.Nearly everybody has a vehicle such as a van or tractor.Because of the simple road we don't have to pay raod tax and the vehicles don't have to pass the M.O.T.The vehicles are mainly used for getting oil,coal,fertilizer, groceries,visitors luggage and post from the quay,also for carrying flowers for export.But on June 25th 1985,one of the vans was used to ferry H.R.H.Prince Charles from the quay to Middletown,so he could see the S.W.E.B.men laying the mains electricity cables.
